quizzes.title: History Quiz: Gemstone and Series
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, jemstone, kind. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: With songs like Up The Beach, Ted, Just Admit It, and Summertime Rolls this album is a regular on my playlist.

options.text: Trout Mask Replica by Captain Beefheart and His Magic Band
The Mind is a Terrible Thing To Taste by Ministry

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nothings Shocking by Janes Addiction

questions.question: The name of this violet variety of quartz comes from Ancient Greek and means not intoxicated.
Complete the old joke about questionable stones: Whether its a _________ or a pink sapphire depends on whether youre the buyer or the seller.
Name the Fleet Admiral who commands the Marine in the series One Piece.
Known as The Victory Stone, it was said to be Alexander the Greats favourite gemstone.
What One Piece chracter, nicknamed King of Snipers Sogeking, is the crews marksman?
What character from the series One Piece is a blue-nosed reindeer who gained human properties?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tony Tony Chopper

questions.question: This punk icon declared the night a possession of lovers, lust and us.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Patti Smith

questions.question: Australia is the largest producer of this gemstone, which fluoresces under UV light and displays color play,
What is the other name of bloodstone whose red spots were believed to be formed by the blood of Jesus Christ?
This gemstone originates as a soft, sticky tree resin and sometimes contains insects and other animal material.
In 1935, the Brazilian government presented Eleanor Roosevelt with this gemstone, which is a form of the mineral beryl.
In ancient times this opaque jemstone was known as a rain-bringer. Its name means spotted or speckled stone.
What olive green gemstone was called Evening Emerald by Romans?
What kind of gem is The Black Star of Queensland which was discovered accidentally in the 1930s and was initially used as a door stop?

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Film and Artist
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, cartoon, bass. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: De Beers is a diamond cartel founded by Cecil Rhodes.
With Reggae classics like Draw Your Brakes, Pressure Drop and Sitting In Limbo, this film soundtrack is an essential piece of any spectacular IPod. Can you name the  film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Harder They Come

questions.question: This masterpiece is made up of four parts comprised of Acknowledgement,Resolution,Pursuance and Psalm. Can you name what is possibly the greatest jazz album ever recorded?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Love Supreme

questions.question: With the power bass of Badmotorfinger, the killer lyrics of Superunknown, or the raw power of Louder Than Love, this band is an essential part of any great shuffle.
Odelay, Mellow Gold and Guero make a rainy day feel like L.A., so I have a healthy dose of this artist on my IPod and on call. Can you name him?
Spiderman was the top ranked superhero on IGNs Top 100 Comic Book Heroes of All Time in 2011.
Music plays an integral role in this Zack Snyder special effects extravaganza featuring girls fighting gas mask-wearing soldiers, dragons, and gigantic samurai.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sucker Punch

questions.question: A large part of mined diamonds are used for the industrial purposes of cutting, drilling, grinding, and polishing.

This artist had a period between 1972-1976 when there was no one on the planet who could touch his level of social conscience and artistry. With songs like As, Living For The City, and You Are The Sunshine of My Life, he created a new way of listening to music.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stevie Wonder

questions.question: What was Ingrid Bergmans first Hollywood film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Intermezzo: A Love Story

questions.question: Diamonds are the hardest substance on Earth.
There have been more than 8 cartoon series starring Spiderman.
The album Hot Buttered Soul  was recorded by the the only artist who can make Burt Bacharach funky. Name this guy who invented the word, Hyperbolicsyllabicsesquedalymistic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isaac Hayes

questions.question: The Green Goblin was the first costumed villain Spiderman faces in which art-form?
In 1956 Ingrid Bergman returned to Hollywood with this film.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Diamonds and Fire
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, summer, signs. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following is used to light the Olympic Fire, one of the most notable symbols of the Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a parabolic mirror

questions.question: Name the Titan who stole fire from Zeus and gave it to mortals.
Which phrase denotes a place of after-death punishment of the wicked in Christian religion?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lake of fire

questions.question: What term refers to an impulse to deliberately start fires to relieve tension?
The presence of diamonds in Sierra Leone led to a civil war in the 1990s.
The 40th wedding anniversary is known as a diamond wedding anniversary.
This author coined the term pyrokinesis to refer to character Charlie McGees ability to create or to control fire with the mind.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stephen King

questions.question: Which of the following astrological signs is not associated with fire, one of the four classical elements?
Diamonds Are a Girls Best Friend is a song famously performed by Marilyn Monroe.
It is considered that diamonds protect from evil forces and bring health to their owner, but only if acquired in a fair way.
A summer time ritual involving a spectacular firefall was practiced from 1872 until 1968 in this US national park.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yosemite National Park

questions.question: The word diamond is derived from the Greek word adámas which means precious.
The scepter of the British monarch includes one of the largest diamonds in the world, the Cullinan I.
The Taylor-Burton Diamond is cut in the shape of a heart.
In the coming-of-age 1985 movie St. Elmos Fire why does Billy (Rob Lowe) compare Jules behavior to St. Elmos fire?

options.text: Because her problems are merely an illusion
Because he thinks she is his guiding light
Because she has an extravagant lifestyle

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Because her problems are merely an illusion

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Bride and Egypt
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, egypt, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In ancient Egypt neither women nor men wore makeup.
What royal bride assumed the title Her Royal Highness, The Duchess of York when she married the second son of Queen Elizabeth II in 1986?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Ferguson

questions.question: Which of these British royal brides wore a wreath of fragrant orange blossoms instead of a diamond encrusted tiara?
What part of an Egyptian pharaohs body was never allowed to be seen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His hair

questions.question: Who was the first British royal bride to place her wedding bouquet on the Tomb of the Unknown Warrior, which honours the unknown dead of WWI?

options.text: Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon (aka Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth Bowes-Lyon (aka Queen Elizabeth The Queen Mother)

questions.question: What Academy Award-winning movie tells the fact-based story of of two athletes participating in the 1924 Olympic Games?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chariots of Fire

questions.question: The terms thimithi, anastenaria, nestinarstvo refer to what ritual involving fire?
Which of these British monarchs abdicated from the throne to marry a divorced woman with two ex-husbands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Edward VIII

questions.question: Who was the first royal bride in history to omit the word obey from her wedding vows?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lady Diana

questions.question: In order to deter flies from landing on his body, Pepi II of Egypt would keep around him several naked slaves whose bodies were covered with honey.
After the white wedding of this queen and Prince Albert, the white gown quickly became the standard bridal attire.
Who was Prince Charles dating when he first met his future bride, lady Diana Spencer in 1977?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dianas sister, Sarah

questions.question: Who is the first British royal bride to have a university degree?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: Who was was the first member of the British royal family to marry in a civil ceremony in England?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles, Prince of Wales

questions.question: Why did the Queen Mother initially object to Elizabeth IIs marriage to Prince Philip?

options.text: He was not of noble origin.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He had ties to Germany.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Egypt and Grace Kelly
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, egypt, giza. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Grace Kelly appeared in more TV movies than big screen movies.
How many feature films was Grace Kelly in?
Who established himself as ruler of Egypt following Alexander the Greats death?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ptolemy Soter

questions.question: The Treaty of Versailles was one of the peace treaties that ended this war.
Katharine Hepburn co-starred with Spencer Tracy years before Bette Davis did.
In ancient Egypt, what did rich Egyptians wear in order to be distinguished from common people?
Which of the following was invented by ancient Egyptians?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of the following statements refers to Ramses II, known as Ramses the Great?

options.text: He was over 90 years old when he died.
He had 8 official wives and almost 100 concubines.
He was allegedly defeated by the Hittite army in the legendary battle of Kadesh in 1288.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In ancient Egypt infections were treated with mouldy bread.
Which actress starred with Cary Grant in a series 1930s comedies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: K. Hepburn

questions.question: What war did the Treaty of Paris, signed in 1763, end?

options.text: Military alliance between France and England against Spain

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Seven Years War

questions.question: The Pyramid of Giza is the oldest of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, and the only one to remain largely intact till present day.
This Treaty of Paris forced the Spanish to remove their forces from the Lombardy region of northern Italy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Treaty of Paris (1623)

questions.question: What movie earned Grace Kelly the Academy Award for Best Actress?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Country Girl

questions.question: Women in ancient Egypt enjoyed legal and economic equality with men.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: John Edward and Actress
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, john, books. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In which TV show has John Edward appeared?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This monarchs reign, one of the longest in European history, ended in 1715.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Louis XIV

questions.question: Psychic medium John Edward was raised Roman Catholic.
Which of the following books are written by him John Edward?

options.text: What If God Were the Sun
After Life: Answers From the Other Side

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which actress was box office poison because of her series of movie flops and negative fan polls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katharine Hepburn

questions.question: What was John Edwards occupation before becoming a psychic medium?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dancing instructor

questions.question: Name John Edwards show that debuted in March 2006 on We TV.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Edward Cross Country

questions.question: The importance of this empire was said to have ended at the Battle of Poltava in 1709, a major part of the Great Northern War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Swedish Empire

questions.question: This war started in 1701, when the King of France tried to unite both France and Spain under a single Emperor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: War of the Spanish Succession

questions.question: Which actress did Kim Carnes sing about in 1981?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bette Davis

questions.question: What conclusion concerning John Edwards psychic abilities was made in Gary Schwartzs book The Afterlife Experiments?

options.text: that Edward has used foreknowledge about audience members

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: that Edwards abilities were genuine

questions.question: A New Jersey woman told John Edward that one day he would become internationally known with his psychic abilities.
Why has psychic medium John Edward been criticised?

options.text: because of performing the mentalist techniques of hot reading and cold reading
because of his exploitation of the 9/11 tragedy
because his apparent accuracy on television is inflated by the editing process

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: TV psychic John Edward was born in Glen Cove, New York.
What TV show did John Eduard produce and host from 1999 to 2004?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crossing Over with John Edward
